feed.title: Nick Goberville
feed.subtitle: The professional portfolio of Nick Goberville, a Ph.D. engineer and systems architect. Explore projects focused on designing simple, robust, and scalable solutions for complex technical challenges, from pure software applications to hardware-software integration.

entry.title: Architected a Modular Replay System (LARS) for Automated Vehicle Testing

link.title: Architected a Modular Replay System (LARS) for Automated Vehicle Testing

entry.summary: Developed and deployed a vehicle-agnostic system to enable repeatable and consistent testing of automated controllers across multiple platforms.

entry.title: Deployed a VIL Test Platform to CARB facility for the EcoCAR Dynamometer Event

link.title: Deployed a VIL Test Platform to CARB facility for the EcoCAR Dynamometer Event

entry.summary: Led the design and implementation of a standardized Vehicle-in-the-Loop (VIL) communication interface, enabling repeatable and collaborative dynamometer testing for 13 university teams.

entry.title: Architected a Comma.ai-based VIL Test Platform for Rapid Controller Deployment

link.title: Architected a Comma.ai-based VIL Test Platform for Rapid Controller Deployment

entry.summary: Developed a vehicle-agnostic software framework fully integrated with Comma.ai hardware, enabling rapid deployment and testing of new autonomous control algorithms on a physical vehicle.

entry.title: Bakery Pricing Tool
entry.summary: Yes, you read that right. I developed a full-stack web application to accurately calculate profit margins for baked goods, featuring a SQLite backend, a Python-based calculation engine, and a Streamlit front-end.

entry.title: Characterized Sensor Performance in Real-World Weather Conditions

link.title: Characterized Sensor Performance in Real-World Weather Conditions

entry.summary: Designed a static sensor array and developed a data logging and analysis pipeline to quantify the effects of weather on LiDAR, camera, and radar sensors.
